queries.query_name: Incorrect Volume Claim Access Mode ReadWriteOnce
queries.description: Kubernetes Stateful Sets must have one Volume Claim template with the access mode 'ReadWriteOnce'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-builder.spec.volumeClaimTemplates has only one template with a 'ReadWriteOnce'

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-builder.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-builder.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-builder.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-builder.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-worker.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-worker.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-worker.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-substra-backend-worker.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Roles or ClusterRoles with RBAC permissions to run commands in containers via 'kubectl exec' could be abused by attackers to execute malicious code in case of compromise. To prevent this, the 'pods/exec' verb should not be used in production environments

queries.query_name: RBAC Roles with Read Secrets Permissions
queries.description: Roles and ClusterRoles with get/watch/list RBAC permissions on Kubernetes secrets are dangerous and should be avoided. In case of compromise, attackers could abuse these roles to access sensitive data, such as passwords, tokens and keys

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-substra-backend-worker}}.rules[0] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-substra-backend-worker}}.rules[0] is granted read access (verbs: get, watch, list) to Secrets objects

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-substra-backend-builder}}.rules[1] should not be granted read access to Secrets objects
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-substra-backend-builder}}.rules[1] is granted read access (verbs: get, list, watch, create, update, patch, delete) to Secrets objects

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
